verses.roman:
tāṅhā śune loke kahe anyonye bāt
eka sannyāsī āsi' dekhi' jagannātha

synonyms: tāṅhā—at that place; śune—they hear; loke—the people in general; kahe—talk; anyonye—among themselves; bāt—topics; eka—one; sannyāsī—mendicant; āsi'-coming there; dekhi'-seeing; jagannātha—the Deity of Lord Jagannātha.
translation: There the devotees heard the people talking about a mendicant who had come to Jagannātha Purī and seen the Deity of Jagannātha.
